{include "default_salutation"} –

We have been watching closely alongside you as COVID-19 news changes by the hour.

We are committed to doing everything we can to help secure the health, safety, and civil liberties of all Granite Staters and believe that any response to this pandemic must protect vulnerable people and be grounded in science and public health.

Directly after New Hampshire was placed under a state of emergency last Friday, we released recommendations that government officials and other decision makers must consider to achieve a fair and effective response to COVID-19. We know that viruses like COVID-19 do not distinguish between economic, immigration, or incarceration status – and so all people must be protected.

  • All Granite Staters, regardless of insurance status, financial means, immigration status, or incarceration status should have access to testing and treatment.
  • People in prisons and jails should have access to hygiene supplies and medical care – and any lock-downs or interruptions in regular activities in jails or prisons should be based solely on the best science available and should be as limited as possible in scope and duration.
  • All people must maintain their constitutional right to due process, including the right to challenge any detention or quarantine.

Read more about our recommendations here.

We will be watching closely to ensure the State of New Hampshire's and counties' responses are no more intrusive on civil liberties than absolutely necessary.

We send our sincere wishes that you and your family remain safe and healthy.

Sincerely,

Devon Chaffee
Executive Director, ACLU of {affiliate_name}
